channel.title: BBC News - World

item.title: Oregon Bootleg Fire: Evacuations as largest US fire burns 300,000 acres
item.description: The nation's largest active wildfire forces thousands to evacuate in the state of Oregon.

item.title: Microsoft: Chinese authorities slam 'groundless' hacking claims
item.description: A group of Western countries had accused China of carrying out a major cyber-attack on the tech giant.

item.title: Jeff Bezos to blast into space aboard New Shepard rocket ship
item.description: Billionaire Jeff Bezos will launch into space in the first crewed flight of his rocket ship.

item.title: Singapore shocked by killing of boy, 13, at school
item.description: A 16-year-old student is charged with murder after a body is found in a bathroom and an axe seized.

item.title: Twitter suspends Marjorie Taylor Greene over 'misleading' Covid posts
item.description: Georgia Republican Marjorie Taylor Greene has been a vocal critic of vaccines and the use of masks.

item.title: Norway fined for wearing shorts not bikini bottoms
item.description: Norway are fined 1,500 euros (£1,295) for wearing shorts instead of bikini bottoms at the European Beach Handball Championships.

item.title: Pedro Castillo declared president-elect of Peru
item.description: The leftist candidate won the popular vote but had been accused of fraud by rival Keiko Fujimori.

item.title: Canada to open border to fully vaccinated Americans in August
item.description: The loosening of restrictions comes amid significant progress in the country's vaccine rates.

item.title: Ben & Jerry's to stop sales in Palestinian territories
item.description: The ice-cream maker said it was “inconsistent with our values” to continue selling products in the region.

item.title: Covid: Asia follows global shares slide amid recovery fears
item.description: Stocks in Asia follow Monday's falls, but shares in Europe make a brighter start on Tuesday.

item.title: Iraq attack: Bombing at Baghdad market kills Eid shoppers
item.description: At least 25 people are killed in an attack on a busy market in Iraq's capital, security sources say.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Athletes find new ways to train in lockdown
item.description: Participants in the upcoming Games have been going to unusual lengths to stay in shape under restrictions.

item.title: A weekend in America: Shootings in Washington spotlight growing problem
item.description: A stadium was sent into panic and a six-year-old was killed in two of the weekend's worst shootings.

item.title: Pegasus: Who are the alleged victims of spyware targeting?
item.description: Jamal Khashoggi's wife and the editor of the Financial Times are among those said to be targeted.

item.title: First space tourist Dennis Tito: 'I was euphoric'
item.description: Dennis Tito paid $20 million to travel to the International Space Station in 2001.

item.title: Covid: Ivermectin, milk among Indonesia's unproven cures
item.description: As Indonesia sees a surge fueled by the Delta variant, misleading health claims are spreading.

item.title: The little tech firm gunning for an airspeed record
item.description: Electroflight has built the E-NXT which it hopes will break the electric airspeed record.

item.title: NYPD officer uses crisp packet to save stabbing victim
item.description: The police officer in New York has been praised for his decisive actions.

item.title: India farmers' protest: Living on a highway in protest
item.description: Seven months on, farmers are still striking against contentious new laws outside the national capital.

item.title: Lex Gillette: Record-breaking blind long jumper
item.description: With the support of his sighted guide, the four-time Paralympic medallist hopes to win gold in Tokyo.

item.title: Moment New York mum saves five-year-old from kidnap
item.description: The mother pulled her son from a car after he was taken from her in broad daylight in the New York City.

item.title: Europe floods: Residents return home to see damage inflicted
item.description: Resident in Kleivelderweg, deep inside the Dutch disaster zone, find homes and businesses destroyed.
